newsitem.title: USA: AnnTaylor sees Q2 results below forecast.
newsitem.headline: AnnTaylor sees Q2 results below forecast.

text.p: Women's specialty retailer AnnTaylor Stores Corp said Thursday its second quarter earnings would not meet expectations set by Wall Street analysts due to a sales shortfall in June.

"However, assuming the company maintains flat comparable store sales in the fall season, earnings per share for the full year are expected to meet analysts' current consensus earnings estimates of approximately $1.00 per share," it said in a statement.

First Call's consensus among analysts foresaw a profit of $0.17 a share for the second quarter against a profit of $0.03 for the same period last year. The consensus also forecast a profit of $1.01 for the year against $0.53 last year.
An AnnTaylor official said the company will release its results on August 19.

The company said in the same statement that comparable store sales for the five-week period ended July 5 fell 5.8 percent compared with the same period last year due to "fashion misses and inventory levels that were lower than planned." Its stock was trading at 16-1/4 in Thursday morning trade, down 2-5/8 from the previous day's close on the New York Stock Exchange.
